question: Number of dengue cases in Delhi 2000 - 2015 is best represented by:-
exp: Line Cha/Graph: Is a frequency polygon presenting variations by line. It shows the trends of an event over a period of time. No closed loop & no histogram in the background.

question: Interpret the Statistical graph given below:-
exp: Scatter Diagram /Dot diagram - Used in depiction of correlation (Relation B/W two quantitative variable) Positive correlation: 0 > r > +1 (+1 is perfectly positive/ strong correlation) Negative correlation: -1 < r < 0 (-1 is perfectly negative correlation) No correlation r = 0 EXTRA EDGE: - Pearson product-moment correlation is used for ratio/interval scale data - Spearman rank-order correlation is used forordinal scale data

question: A Scatter diagram is drawn to study:
exp: SCATTER DIAGRAM * Also known as 'Correlation diagram' or 'Dot diagram' Is used to depict 'correlation (relationship) between 2 quantitative variables' Veical axis in scatter diagram: should be the dependent or the outcome variable In a scatter diagram, 2 imaginary lines are drawn along the distribution of dots/scatter
opa: Trend of a variable over a period of time
opc: Mean & median values of the given data

question: Height and weight correlation is best represented by:-
exp: Height & weight are quantitative / continuous variables. Correlation is relationship between 2 quantitative or continuous variables. Correlation is represented by: 'Scatter diagram'/ DOT diagram. - Thus, correlation b/w height & weight is depicted by scattered / Dot diagram.

question: Association can be measured by all except:
exp: Association: is any relationship between two measured quantities that render them statistically dependent Association can be measured by Correlation coefficient Odds ratio Good man's and kruskal's Lambda P value Conbach's alpha: is a measurement of internal consistency or reliability. It is paicularly useful in Like scales (grading of continuum)

question: Best statistical data diagram to depict Incidence change over a period of time is
exp: Line diagrams are used to show the trend of events with the passage of time, hence incidence change ( a trend) is best depicted by a line diagram. Other options: In pie cha, areas of the segments of a circle are compared. Extremely popular but statistically inferior to bar chas. Histogram is a pictorial diagram of frequency distribution for continuous class intervals Scatter diagrams show the relationship between two objects. Eg: Positive correlation between the intakes of fat and sugar in average diets.

question: Histogram is used to describe
exp: Histogram: - Is graphical presentation for 'continuous quantitative data' Continuous groups are marked on X-axis (abscissa) while frequencies are marked on y -axis (ordinate).
opa: Quantitative data of a group of patients
opb: Qualitative data of a group of patients
